thread.title: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel
thread.title_full: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel

author: Daniel Milligan
title: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel
text:
09:55 Daniel Milligan Rafa Benitez long-term plans 
An awful lot has happened since the last time Newcastle United lifted a major piece of silverware. 
In fact, if ‘Brexit’ is the outcome of this month’s referendum then this country will have joined the European project, voted to stay in it 41 years ago, and then gone full circle and decided to leave - all within the time it has taken the Magpies to add to their trophy haul. 
There have been a couple of Texaco Cups, an Anglo-Italian Cup, two second-tier titles, and even the UEFA Intertoto Cup - but no major trophy since 1969. 
On June 11, 1969, Bob Moncur - now a member of the Newcastle board - held aloft the Inter-Cities Fairs Cup in the Megyeri uti Stadium in Budapest following the Magpies’ 6-2 aggregate victory over Ujpesti Dozsa. 
Newcastle supporters’ wait for further now glory stands at 47 years and counting. 09:49 Daniel Milligan Pervert sexually assaulted two sleeping girls 
A pervert who groped two young girls as they slept and molested a teenager after plying her with drink has been jailed. 
Michael Todd admitted sexually assaulting two youngsters when they were as young as seven while they were asleep. 
And while on bail for those offences, he groped a 14-year-old girl after plying her with vodka and lager. 
Now the 37-year-old has been jailed for three years at Newcastle Crown Court after he admitted six offences of sexual assault. 09:40 Daniel Milligan International news 
An attacker has stormed a gay nightclub in Florida and is reported to have taken hostages. 
The shooting happened at the Pulse Club in Orlando causing people to flee in terror. 
Eyewitnesses say the attacker stormed the club before shooting about 20 people. 
The gunman is feared to have shot towards the crowd, with about 100 people inside. 09:31 Daniel Milligan Jarrow parade 
Mayor’s Sunday Parade in Jarrow today. 
Parade leaves Hedworthfield Primary School using Linkway, Fellgate Av, Durham Dr and St Joseph’s Way to St Joseph’s Catholic Church. 
It then makes the return journey an hour later. Expect rolling road closures 09:30-10:15 and 11:15-12:00 in the Fellgate area until 12:00 09:23 Daniel Milligan 
One to watch out for on the Central Motorway. 09:15 Daniel Milligan Controversial plans to build 285 homes 
Campaigners are celebrating after controversial plans to build hundreds of homes and almost double the size of a Northumberland village were refused for a second time. 
Barratt Developments applied to build 285 homes in New Hartley, near Seaton Delaval , claiming it would create 440 jobs and generate £55m for the economy. 
The development would have increased the size of the village by 45% and more than 800 people objected against the proposals. 
In April, Northumberland County Council’s strategic planning committee rejected the application over concerns about the size of development and lack of affordable housing. 
However, councillors were asked to review their five reasons for refusal after the authority was warned it could face “substantial costs” if an appeal was lodged. 
At a meeting on Tuesday, the committee reduced their reasons to one, which represented their best chance of it being defended at an appeal. 09:09 Daniel Milligan Sunday's weather forecast 
Another cloudy day, with light onshore winds continuing to bring low cloud and a little rain to the area, particularly early in the day, with some limited brighter spells later in the day. 
Fog occasionally affecting the Cheviots and Pennines. Maximum Temperature 16 °C. 
Tonight: A cloudy night is in prospect with some patchy light rain or drizzle in places and hill fog. Winds remaining light. Minimum Temperature 12 °C. 09:00 Daniel Milligan Good morning 
Welcome to The Chronicle’s live breaking news blog for Sunday, June 12, 2016. 
Here, are our regular updates throughout the day of all the breaking news and sport from across the North East. 
We have pictures, video, tweets and comments covering the latest Newcastle and North East traffic, weather forecasts, crime and council news too. 
It’s Daniel Milligan at the helm for the afternoon and into the evening. I’ll be keeping you updated on what’s going on across the region including the latest on the roads for the rush-hour and any breaking news incidents that occur as we move through the day. 
You can contribute to the live blog by tweet us @EveningChron to share breaking news stories, pictures and opinions. My details are: 
Phone: 0191 201 6169 Email: daniel.milligan@trinitymirror.com Twitter: @danielrmilligan
